t: What should I do if one of my phone charger's plug prongs are bent? I straightened it and it still works but is it safe to use? It's the EU type of plug. - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 3): The voltage expressed at the connection to the phone is low as is the current. Also, the charger probably has short circuit protection (unless the phone is cheap). The pins at the wall outlet are a different story. If the pin is still sturdy, you should be OK as the current is lo...

t: Is it safe to put a bent prong into an outlet? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 20): If it has only been bent once or twice, I wouldn’t worry about bending it back with your fingers and plugging it in. If you were to bend it back and forth about 50 times, it will break off. Before it breaks off there will be a visible line where the prong meets the plastic ...
